6odvq6q1cs1dabgg3asmqrjpfv.name: Verizon Finance Networking Event
6odvq6q1cs1dabgg3asmqrjpfv.description:
We hope you’ll join us at this event! Please pre-register here!
https://www.applytracking.com/tp/rj6-bw90X.I.K

Verizon welcomes CMU students for a networking event to discuss finance opportunities within our company! As part of the Finance organization, you will help some of the world’s biggest enterprises do business smarter. Come out and meet with two Verizon Campus Recruiters! We can't wait to see you there.
Verizon’s campus program is an important contributor to delivering the promise of the digital world by enhancing the ability of humans, businesses and society to do more new and do more good. Student talent inspires and contributes to our growth by bringing a different perspective to our workforce. Our program remains competitive through internships, co-ops, entry-level, and leadership development programs within many areas of our business..

At this event, you'll have the opportunity to network with representatives from Verizon so that you can learn more about us, and we can learn more about you.

12sg2n9v3gvc12g3sl1if4hhlc.name: IBM Services - US Federal Info Session
12sg2n9v3gvc12g3sl1if4hhlc.description:
HEINZ COLLEGE:

~ OPPORTUNITIES FOR US CITIZENS ONLY~

IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences via Cognitive data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. With global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, IBM Services empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge in the cognitive era in over 170 countries.

IBM’s US Federal Sector is a division within IBM Services that offers consultative approaches for federal, state and local governments and agencies. Our clients range from defense and intelligence, healthcare, homeland security and foreign affairs. Our practice areas include: Advanced Analytics, Watson Artificial Intelligence, IoT/Supply Chain Management, Digital Business Strategy, Talent & Engagement. At this information session, Managing Consultants and Data Scientists will provide consulting experiences from their careers at IBM and share more insight into our recruitment process for incoming Senior Consultants.

7cvjea7d6ft0ctgtb85ppfeo3n.name: Accenture Strategy Launch Event
7cvjea7d6ft0ctgtb85ppfeo3n.description:
Hi everyone!

Accenture Strategy will be recruiting from CMU this year for the first time! Similar to McKinsey, Bain and BCG, Accenture Strategy focuses on developing a roadmap for consultant implementation by utilizing deep industry expertise, analytics and insights. This distinguished vertical of Accenture is a great way to start your career in Strategy work and Consulting! Attend this event to gain personal time with the head CMU recruiter and current consultants and analysts! 

Accenture Strategy will be on campus this Friday, September 20th from 5:00-6:30pm. The beginning of the event will take place in TEP 2611 and the networking session will follow in TEP 2612. Dress code is smart casual. Refreshments will be provided!

About the Event
Accenture Strategy is making our debut at Carnegie Mellon this fall. Join us for a fun and interactive Accenture Strategy Launch event to learn more about Accenture Strategy – our people, culture, impactful work and full-time and summer analyst career opportunities! Accenture Strategy recruiting and business representatives will be on site to answer your questions and help you determine if Accenture Strategy is the right place for you to take the next step in your career adventure.

Following are the links to the Handshake positions for Accenture Strategy:
Strategy Analyst
Strategy Summer Analyst

0h7skqql7os21thlaqnqi3drcp.name: Citi Asia Pacific 2020 Summer Internship - Information Session
0h7skqql7os21thlaqnqi3drcp.description:
Interested in working in Asia? Come join us at the Asia Pacific Information Session to find out more about summer internship and full-time opportunities available and working at Citi in Asia.

We will have APAC business representatives from Investment Banking, Capital Markets Origination, and Markets to share about their different business lines and working in Asia. HR representatives will also be onsite to answer any questions you may have, including timelines, making your application competitive, and visa requirements.

This is an exclusive opportunity for students at Carnegie Mellon University to not only learn about the diverse career paths in financial services, but to also get insider tips on working in Asia!

Undergraduates, Masters, and MBA students studying any discipline are welcome to join; though our main target audience will be penultimate year students studying graduating between December 2020 - Summer 2021 and final year students graduating in 2020.

3c5bik8c02bn2fr16bk20lnat8.name: Two Sigma Quant Talk
3c5bik8c02bn2fr16bk20lnat8.description:
Interested in learning how to apply your passion for math, science, technology, and desire to do impactful work?
Come and join Two Sigma's quant researchers, where you can learn about the internship and full-time research opportunities that we offer. At this talk, you can discover how Two Sigma can help you to translate your academic background into the world of quant finance. We look forward to discussing some of the challenges we encounter and the solutions we create to find value in the world’s data.

Food will be provided. Please register for a spot by clicking on "Apply Now" if you’re interested in joining us. We hope to see you there!

5tt0qusvcjlmg0kt0dsstruk7h.name: IQVIA Academy Information Session
5tt0qusvcjlmg0kt0dsstruk7h.description:
Interested in the healthcare/life sciences sector and consulting? Come meet and chat with the IQVIA Academy!

The IQVIA Academy is a leadership development program at the forefront of IQVIA’s top strategic initiative and new business offerings. As a part of the world’s largest provider of biopharmaceutical development and commercial outsourcing services, the Academy provides consulting services to leading firms in the healthcare and pharmaceutical industries. Their practitioners work directly with clients on consulting engagements to support evolving business needs across a variety of business functions. The Academy program also offers leadership development opportunities, career progression & expansion, and exposure to senior leaders in the company. Don’t miss out on this great opportunity to interact with a current IQVIA Academy member and learn more details about the program!

Please bring you ID to check in.

2vmk9590lq87pfju34fpnvjro2.name: KPMG Ignition Tokyo: Information Session
2vmk9590lq87pfju34fpnvjro2.description:
Dear CMU Students.

KPMG Ignition Tokyo will be looking for new Interns from February 2020!

We are holding Information Session on October 8th from 18:00 at Carnegie Mellon University.

A Partner, Director, and Manager from KPMG Ignition Tokyo will be there to explain about our Internship program.

Please feel free to RSVP for joining the event!

< Internship Details >
1) Internship will be in KPMG Ignition’s office in Tokyo and the terms are either 6 or 8 months.
2) Internship will be fully paid with a housing allowance.
3) Employment visa application support also available.
4) Chance to receive a full time job offer after the internship.
5) Internship start date negotiable.

＜Position 1＞Engineer:
Intern students are expected to catch up with knowledge collateral for bleeding edge technologies and participate in programming activities for innovation. Each developer will have a chance to work in a wide range of projects experiencing the use of different technologies (AI and blockchain as the main). All projects worked on are for client delivery.

＜Position 2＞Business and Consulting Research:
Our analysts are responsible for designing and executing the qualitative and quantitative research approach across a wide range of industries and topic areas from consumer insights to disruptive technology trends.

Interns are expected to get involved in the entire innovation process and participate actively from initial visioning all the way through idea generation and follow up activities. Intern students will assist in project management, identifying stakeholder and client needs and bridging them with digital strategy. For this role being able to speak Japanese at a native level is must.

＜Position 3＞Blockchain / Secure Computing Engineering :
As a software developer you will work in a dynamic and evolving environment following the strategic direction of KPMG Japan. You will develop, maintain and improve systems to meet particular needs, often as advised by systems architect. You will also do testing, test automation and bug fixing. Our team develops digital solutions which involve cutting edge technology such as NLP, Machine Learning, OCR, Blockchain, IoT etc. We are particularly looking for blockchain specialized software developer.

＜What is KPMG Ignition Tokyo?＞
KPMG is a professional firm, providing audit, tax and advisory services in Japan. KPMG has more than 162,000 professionals in 155 countries and offers value-added services to address the management issues of our clients all over the world.

KPMG Ignition Tokyo will be the centerpiece of our firm’s digital strategy, merging our professional insights in audit, tax and advisory with the knowledge of our digital experts and the latest digital technology. It will support the digitalization of our own services as well as the digital transformation of our clients, and will be a center for developing the solutions necessary to succeed in an increasingly competitive global landscape.

Should you have any questions, please free to contact us.

KPMG Ignition Tokyo

4624n7nndgkb5rmaflvrp8muil.name: Online Case Interview Workshop
4624n7nndgkb5rmaflvrp8muil.description:
Most management consulting firms incorporate some form of case interview into their interview process. Cases are often viewed by students as daunting and/or intimidating. The purpose of this workshop is to provide an overview of what case interviewing is and how students can practice before the kick-off of interview season, and run through an interactive case interview in real time.

The workshop is hosted by Brendan Boler, a Presidential Fellow at the University of Virginia’s Data Science Institute. Boler specializes in management consulting, high-performance coaching, and talent assessment and selection. He has extensive experience within the fields of management consulting and banking, having worked at Accenture, Goldman Sachs, and Morgan Stanley. Throughout his corporate career, Professor Boler was heavily involved in the recruiting process and has leveraged this experience to conduct research on high-performance coaching, as well as talent assessment and selection. This workshop is sponsored by the University of Virginia's McIntire School of Commerce Graduate Admissions Office.

4iollbpfium5kf04olgpmar12m.name: L'Oreal Information Session
4iollbpfium5kf04olgpmar12m.description:
Want to work for a company that recognizes your individuality, passion, and gives you the opportunity to contribute in meaningful ways from day one? A company devoted to building and shaping your future, that was rated as a WayUp Top 100 internship program 3 years in a row, and is a market leader in its industry with brands such as CeraVe, Maybelline, Kiehl’s, Lancôme, and Urban Decay?

L’Oréal is a global CPG (Consumer Product Goods) leader with 30+ brands making up our diverse portfolio. Our ambition for the coming years is to win over another one billion consumers around the world by creating the cosmetic, skincare, and grooming products that meet the infinite diversity of their beauty needs and desires. Since the company’s creation by a researcher, the group has been pushing the frontiers of knowledge, technology, and innovation.

With this ambition in mind, we are looking for top talent across majors to join us for our competitive Summer Internship Programs. Our interns lead strategic projects that create real business impact, so we are looking for innovators ready to tackle the growing needs of our consumers!

Come meet with the team from L’Oréal to learn more about opportunities within the company, our summer internship program, the Brandstorm Case Competition, and how L’Oréal is using technology to drive innovation.

We are recruiting current juniors for our Summer Internships in:
Marketing
IT
Finance
Human Resources
Sales & Business Development
Operations
Research & Development

11qd2vrsibh0cj3qhmesdu1ji5.description: Want to work in Asia? Come join our Global Wealth Management (GWM) information session. Learn all about the GWM business and the talent programs we offer. Our GWM leaders and recruiters are happy to share their journey with you.

7jfvngr0j0d21ptq3mbnn8j7b9.name: UBS Quant Hackathon 2019
7jfvngr0j0d21ptq3mbnn8j7b9.description:
Theme: Quantitative Investment Strategies

The UBS Quant Hackathon is an online Quant strategy competition including a final live hackathon held at our global UBS offices. Combine your innovative ideas with your Quant skills to tackle real-life financial industry challenges.

Who can participate?

Students from all universities across the globe are welcome to apply. Students with Python programming or technical experience are encouraged to participate, but this is not a requirement.

You will need to form a team of 3-5 people.

Team prizes:
1st prize: $10k
2nd prize: $7k
3rd prize: $3k
